results.title: Funny bones
results.creator_credit: Peter Chelsom, Simon Fields and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Tommy Fawkes (Oliver Platt), is a struggling stand-up comedian trying to live up to the legacy that his famous father George Fawkes (Jerry Lewis) has created. George is now retired, and Tommy is struggling to get his career started. After yet another painful failure onstage, Tommy decides to travel back to Blackpool, England, where his family’s history and comedy originated and during his stay, Tommy discovers some not so funny secrets about his family and his past. During this time he develops a peculiar friendship with the mysterious Jack Parker (Lee Evans), the seemingly dim, comedian-savant. This film, a “black slapstick comedy” goes beyond any genre, utilizing brilliant psychological and physical performances right down to the eyebrow raising cameo from Oliver Reed. Written by Peter Chelsom and Peter Flannery.

results.title: Fun in Acapulco
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: While in Acapulco, Elvis is pretty busy employed as a boat hand, lifeguard, and singer. He’s managed to capture the attention of a few of the local beauties (Ursula Andress, Elsa Cardenas), which fills in most of the spare time he has. He harbours a secret fear of heights however, after a fatal mishap during his career as a trapeze catcher leaves him shaken. Love manage to inspires him to overcome his fear of heights in the most public way possible - diving off a 136 foot cliff. Features the following songs: “Bossa Nova baby”, “You can’t say no in Acapulco”.

results.title: Full alert
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam, Li Kuo-Hsing, Brilliant Idea Group and Young Filmmakers
results.brief_description: After the failure of his first Hollywood film, ‘Maximum Risk’, Lam returned to Hong Kong to shoot this $13 million action film. A claustrophobic police thriller set just after the handover of Hong Kong to China, ‘Full Alert’ revives the ‘film bleu’ tradition of Hong Kong cop and gangster films, its belligerent energy recalling the sense of anarchy in Hong Kong films of the eighties. Inspector Pao is a grizzled, jaded veteran cop who has seen it all in his years with the Hong Kong police. After a vicious murderer escapes to Taiwan, Pau vows to track him down. To him he represents a new kind of criminal— smart, canny, ambitious and vicious— a man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants. As in Michael Mann’s ‘Heat’ (1996) to which ‘Full Alert’ has been compared, the cop and the robber are set up as a pair of compelling twins/opposites driven to battle each other. They increasingly come to resemble each other in motive and character as the film progresses. Cast includes Lau Ching-Wan and Francis Ng. In Cantonese with English and Mandarin subtitles.

results.title: From Mao to Mozart: Isaac Stern in China
results.creator_credit: Murray Lerner and Harmony Film Group
results.brief_description: Isaac Stern and his family visited China for three weeks in 1989 as the guests of the Foreign Minister. Stern visits schools and conservatories of music, giving master classes and concerts, and speaking to music teachers who lived through the Cultural revolution.

results.title: From dusk till dawn
results.creator_credit: Robert Rodriguez, Meir Teper, Gianni Nunnari and A Band Apart
results.brief_description: After pulling off a bloody Texas bank heist, notorious bank robber Seth Gecko and his homicidal, rape-happy brother Ritchie, secure a safe passage across the border into Mexico thanks to the unwilling aid of disillusioned ex-minister Jacob Fuller. After kidnapping the Fuller family, the Gecko brothers elude the authorities and reach a supposed safe haven at a pre-chosen site: a surreal and ultra-sleazy bar in the middle of the desert, where they plan to split the loot with their Mexican connection. Unfortunately, the club is actually a haven for ferocious Aztec vampires; a twist which spins the schizophrenic plot into its second phase. Cast includes George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Harvey Keitel and Juliette Lewis.

results.title: Free Willy
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Lauren Shuler, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: This is a heart warming and touching story about the friendship that develops between an abandoned child living in a foster home and an Orca (Killer Whale) who is confined in a too-small tank at Pacific Northwest aquatic park. At night Willy cries out to his family who frolic in the nearby bay. No-one can undestand his cries and moods - no one except Jesse (Jason James Richter) a 12 year old boy who knows what it is like to be without a family.

results.title: Frances
results.creator_credit: Graeme Clifford, Jonathan Sanger, Brooksfilms and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: This is the story of Frances Farmer, whose troubled life made headlines in the 1930s. At 16, she was an award-winning high-school student in Seattle and at 23, a rising, provocative star of stage and screen, admired for her beauty and talent. At 27, a chain of relatively insignificant events led to her arrest and involuntary committal to a mental institution. Jessica Lange delivers a powerful, harrowing performance as the tormented Frances.

results.title: Fran
results.creator_credit: David Rapsey, Paul D. Barron, Barron Films and Glenda Hambly
results.brief_description: Fran never knew her father, her mother was an alcoholic and she was a ward of the state at age five. Now in her thirties, Fran lives with her three children in suburbia. She is restless and has no intention of settling down. Fran has a way of attracting men and pick ups Jeff, a barman. Their relationship develops to a point where Fran is willing to follow him around the country. Unfortunately, Fran’s three children do not fit in with Jeff’s plans and Fran, blinded by love, dumps them with relatives for a “few days”. A “few days” becomes a few months and the children are placed in a welfare home. Fran’s life then becomes an endless battle with debt collectors and welfare officials, not only fighting for her children but fighting to be loved herself. Cast: Noni Hazlehurst, Alan Fletcher.

results.title: Four weddings and a funeral
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Duncan Kenworthy, Working Title Films, Channel Four and PolyGram
results.brief_description: This charming and quirky British romantic comedy stars Hugh Grant and Andy Macdowell as the two lovers who belong together…perhaps! An excellent cast, including an hilarious cameo by Rowan Atkinson as the tongued-tied vicar, “Four weddings & a funeral” is unashamedly sentimental, but at the same time reveals not only the “funny side” of relationships, but their fragility. As Hugh Grant catapaults from one emotional and social disaster to another, due to an excess of good manners and a very British tendency towards “keeping a stiff upper lip”, he eventually discovers that the course of true love diverges from his expected course down the altar.

results.title: Forgotten silver
results.creator_credit: Sue Rodgers, New Zealand Film Commission, New Zealand On Air, Wingnut Films, Peter Jackson and Costa Botes
results.brief_description: Made in part to celebrate 100 years of cinema, this startling documentary first aired on New Zealand television. When New Zealand film director Peter Jackson stumbles upon an old trunk of nitrate films in a backyard shed, it appears that he has uncovered a lost chapter in New Zealand film history. His discovery leads him to Colin McKenzie, an extraordinary New Zealand born film pioneer and avid inventor from the early 1900s. Jackson’s research reveals that McKenzie was responsible for developing many cinematic innovations including colour film, sync sound and tracking shots that had long been attributed to more famous motion picture pioneers. McKenzie also risked his life to make a silent biblical epic ‘Salome’ in remote bush on the West Coast of the South Island. As Jackson turns up more amazing facts about the McKenzie legacy, it gradually becomes apparent that his documentary is a meticulously staged hoax. The ‘mockumentary’ combines interviews with real people such as actor Sam Neill, film critic Leonard Maltin and Miramax Chairman Harvey Weinstein, with elaborately faked, utterly convincing silent film footage, still photographs and other archival material. Jackson and Botes’ film is a clever, slightly deranged parody of the earnest documentary tributes to the centenary of cinema that were being made at the time. When it first aired on New Zealand television it sparked a minor controversy, enraging viewers who had been duped into believing it was about a real historical subject.
